cds_metadata_version.description: The version of metadata object format this Server follows, which for this version of the specification is v1.

cds_metadata_url.description: A URL link to this metadata object’s canonical network location.

created.description: When the metadata url was first made available.

updated.description: When this metadata object was last modified.

name.description: The name of the utility or entity (e.g. “Demo Gas & Electric”).

description.description: A brief description about the utility or entity (e.g. “An electric and gas utility serving customers in Northern California”).

website.description: Where users can learn more about the utility or entity and its capabilities.

documentation.description: Where Clients can find the utility or entity’s technical reference documentation.

support.description: Where Clients can find contact information for technical support on the Server’s capabilities.

capabilities.description:
What capabilities and functionality this Server supports, which may be an empty array if the Server is not offering any additional capabilities beyond just this metadata object.
If the list of capabilities includes coverage, this array MUST also include a union of the capabilities listed in the Coverage Endpoint list of Coverage Entry objects’ capabilities values.

coverage.description: Where to find the Coverage Endpoint. This field is REQUIRED if coverage is listed in the capabilities array.

related_metadata.description: Where to find other related Metadata Endpoints.

oauth_metadata.description: Endpoint for oauth metadata, only available if capabilities includes 'oauth'.

registration_endpoint.description: OAuth’s Dynamic Client Registration functionality is required to enable the Client Registration Process.

scopes_supported.description: The scopes in this array MUST represent a union of all scope id values contained in the cds_scope_descriptions objects.

service_documentation.description: Developer documentation is required by the Server to help streamline Client integration.

op_policy_uri.description: Policies for Clients registering is required.

op_tos_uri.description: Terms of use for Clients registering is required.

revocation_endpoint.description: OAuth’s Token Revocation functionality is required.

code_challenge_methods_supported.description: The code challenge methods in this array MUST represent a union of all code_challenge_methods_supported values contained in the cds_scope_descriptions objects.

authorization_endpoint.description: Contains the authorization endpoint, might only be available after client registration

cds_oauth_version.description: The version of the CDS-WG1-02 Client Registration specification that the Server has implemented, which for this version of the specification is v1

cds_human_registration.description: Where Clients who do not have the technical capacity to use the registration_endpoint can visit to manually register a Client using a user device

cds_clients_api.description: The base url for the Clients API.

cds_messages_api.description: The base url for the Clients Messages API.

cds_credentials_api.description: The base url for the Scope Credentials API.

cds_grants_api.description: The base url for the Grants API.

cds_server_provided_files_api.description: The URL for the Server-Provided Files API. This MUST be included if scopes_supported includes the server_provided_files scope.

cds_test_accounts.description: Where Clients can find developer documentation on what test account credentials may be used for testing OAuth response_type=code authorization requests

cds_scope_descriptions.description: An object providing additional information about what Scope values listed in scopes_supported mean. This object MUST include a key for each Scope listed in scopes_supported with a Scope Description as that key’s value.

cds_registration_fields.description: An object providing additional information about Registration Field that are referenced in Scope Description’s registration_requirements list. This object MUST include a key for each Registration Field id included in the registration_requirements lists in the metadata object with a Registration Field as that key’s value. If all registration_requirements lists are empty, this reference object is an empty object ({}).

cds_customerdata_accounts_api.description: The base URL for the Accounts API.

cds_customerdata_servicecontracts_api.description: The base URL for the Service Contracts API.

cds_customerdata_servicepoints_api.description: The base URL for the Service Points API.

cds_customerdata_meterdevices_api.description: The base URL for the Meter Devices API.

cds_customerdata_billstatements_api.description: The base URL for the Bill Statements API.

cds_customerdata_billsections_api.description: The base URL for the Bill Sections API.

cds_customerdata_aggregations_api.description: The base URL for the Aggregations API.

cds_customerdata_usagesegments_api.description: The base URL for the Usage Segments API.

authorization_details_types_supported.description: OAuth’s Rich Authorization Requests functionality is required. This array of values MUST be the same as scopes_supported.

pushed_authorization_request_endpoint.description: OAuth’s Pushed Authorization Requests functionality is required.

response_types_supported.description: The response types in this array MUST represent a union of all response_types_supported values contained in the cds_scope_descriptions objects.

grant_types_supported.description: The response types in this array MUST represent a union of all grant_types_supported values contained in the cds_scope_descriptions objects.

token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported.description: The response types in this array MUST represent a union of all token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported values contained in the cds_scope_descriptions object.

id.description: The unique identifier of the scope. This MUST be the same value as the object key the Metadata Object’s cds_scope_descriptions object.

name.description: A human-readable name of the scope.

description.description: A human-readable description of what access or actions the scope will enable.

documentation.description: Where developers can find documentation for the scope.

registration_requirements.description: A list of any registration fields that MUST be submitted with Client Registration Requests or requirements that must be completed after registration before the scope is available to use in the Server’s production environment. All values in this array MUST be included in the Metadata Object’s cds_registration_fields object for a complete description of the requirement. If no additional requirements are needed, this value is an empty array ([]).

registration_optional.description: A list of any registration fields that Clients MAY submit with the Client Registration Requests. If no additional fields are available, this value is an empty array ([]).

response_types_supported.description: The OAuth response_type values that can be used with this scope. This value follows the same behavior as OAuth’s Metadata object response_types_supported, except that this value represents the response types supported for this individual scope and not all scopes for the Client. If a scope is not available for OAuth authorization requests (e.g. a client_credentials-only scope), this value is an empty array ([]).

grant_types_supported.description: The OAuth grant type values that can be used with this scope. This value follows the same behavior as OAuth’s Metadata object grant_types_supported, except that this value represents the grant types supported for this individual scope and not all scopes for the Client. This array MUST contain at least one grant type.

token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported.description: The OAuth client authentication methods that can be used for granting tokens with this scope. This value follows the same behavior as OAuth’s Metadata object token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported, except that this value represents the client authentication methods supported for this individual scope and not all scopes for the Client. A value of "none" this array indicates that the scope may be used for public application without using a client secret.

code_challenge_methods_supported.description: For scope descriptions where grant_types_supported includes the value authorization_code, OAuth’s Proof Key for Code Exchange by OAuth Public Clients functionality is required, and Servers MUST offer S256 and MUST NOT offer plain code verifier methods. For scope descriptions where grant_types_supported does not include authorization_code, no authorization request is performed, so no code challenge is required and this field value is and empty list ([]).

authorization_details_fields.description: A list of fields that MAY be included in Rich Authorization Requests the authorization details object for this scope type. If no extra authorization details fields are available, this value is an empty list ([]).

id.description: The unique identifier of the authorization details field. This value is used as the key for the field when added to authorization_details data fields as part of OAuth’s Rich Authorization Requests.

name.description: A human-readable name of the authorization details field.

description.description: A human-readable description of what submitting values for this authorization details field means.

documentation.description: Where developers can find more information about this authorization details field.

anyOf.description: A relative or absolute date string. Relative dates are formatted as defined by duration in RFC 3339 Appendix A. For example, P3Y represents a relative date range of 3 years. Absolute dates are formatted as date (YYYY-MM-DD). For example, 2024-01-02 represents the 2nd of January, 2024. Dates are defined as the date from the perspective of the Server’s local timezone.
An integer value.

A decimal value, which can have any number of significant units, but MUST NOT be stored or handled as a float value, in order to retain the precision of the value throughout Server and Client processing.

format.description: The data format that MUST be used in the value of the field when including it as a data field in authorization_details objects.

default.description: The default value that will be used in lieu of the Client submitting a value themselves. This is also the value that will be used if a basic OAuth scope string parameter is used instead of an authorization_details parameter.

relative_date_limit.description: If format is relative_or_absolute_date, this is the largest relative date range that may be submitted. Servers MUST validate both submitted absolute dates and relative dates against the relative date limit, where when comparing to a submitted absolute date, the current Server date in the Server’s local timezone is used as the relative point of reference.

absolute_date_limit.description: If format is relative_or_absolute_date, this is the furthest away date that may be submitted. Servers MUST validate both submitted absolute dates and relative dates against the absolute date limit, where when comparing to a submitted relative date, the current Server date in the Server’s local timezone is used as the relative point of reference.

limit.description: If format is one of int or decimal, this is the largest value that can be the submitted.

id.description: The unique identifier of the registration field. This MUST be the same value as the object key the Metadata Object’s cds_registration_fields object.

type.description: What type of Registration Field this entry is.

description.description: A human-readable description of what should be submitted or expected for this registration field.

documentation.description: Where developers can find more information about this registration field.

field_name.description: If type is registration_field, this is the name of the field to submit in the Client Registration Request and MUST start with cds_.

format.description: If type is registration_field, this is the data format that MUST be used in the value of the field.

default.description: If type is registration_field and the field is optional, this is the default value that will be used in lieu of the Client submitting a value themselves. Including this default value in the object indicates the registration field is optional.

max_length.description: If format is one of string, string_or_null, url, url_or_null, email, or email_or_null, this is the maximum length of the submitted value, if not null.

max_size.description: If format is one of image, image_or_null, pdf, or pdf_or_null, this is the maximum file size of the submitted value before encoding into Base64, if not null.

amount.description: If type is payment_required, this is the amount in currency that will be required to complete registration.

currency.description: If type is payment_required, this is the monetary currency in ISO 4217 currency code.

RegistrationFieldType.description: Registration Field types define which type of action the Client or Server will take for that registration field. Registration Fields can be either something that MUST or MAY be submitted as part of the Client Registration Request, depending on the submitted scope’s registration_requirements and registration_optional values, or can be something that a Client must do after registration in order to be full approved for use in the production environment.

anyOf.description: This field should be submitted with the Client Registration Request as the field_name. This type of registration field MUST also have field_name and format values. If this field is optional as part of registration, default must also be defined in the registration field object.

This field indicates that the Server will manually review the registration before approving it for production use. Notifications and communication about the status of this manual review will be conveyed using the Client Messages API.

This field indicates that a setup payment will be required before the Server will approve the Client for production use. Notifications and communication about how to pay and confirmation of payment will be conveyed using the Client Messages API.

This field indicates that the Client must verify their email before the Server will approve the Client for production use. Notifications and communication about how to verify the Client’s contact email will be conveyed using the Client Messages API.

RegistrationFieldFormat.description: Registration Field formats define the data type of submitted values for these fields in Client Registration Requests.

anyOf.description: If required, a string value MUST be submitted.
Same as string, only with null being an additional possible value.
If required, a URL value MUST be submitted
Same as url, only with null being an additional possible value.
If required, a valid email address string MUST be submitted.
Same as email, only with null being an additional possible value.
If required, either true or false MUST be submitted.
Same as boolean, only with null being an additional possible value.
If required, a valid image file formatted as image/jpeg or image/png encoded as a string using Base64 MUST be submitted.
Same as image, only with null being an additional possible value.
If required, a valid pdf file formatted encoded using Base64 as a string MUST be submitted.
Same as pdf, only with null being an additional possible value.

scope.description: A space separated list containing all the scopes that should be available for the client.

anyOf.description: Access to basic customer account information.
Access to the current contact information for a customer’s accounts.
Access to detailed information for a customer’s accounts.
Access to a customer’s list of service contracts (e.g. an electrical, natural gas, or water service) with some basic information about each service.
Access to the energy supplier or retailer information for a customer’s service contracts.
Access to detailed service contract information for a customer’s services.
Access to the current amounts due for a customer’s accounts.
Access to basic information about a customer’s bill statements.
Access to detailed information about a customer’s bill statements.
Access to the raw files (e.g. pdf bills) for a customer’s bill statements.
Access to summary data of a customer’s bill sections.
Access to detailed data of a customer’s bill sections.
Access to basic usage data for a customer’s service contracts.
Access to detailed usage data for a customer’s service contracts.
Approval for being included in an aggregation (e.g. whole-building benchmarking).

Client.description: Modeled after Client Registration Response, see: https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7591#section-3.2.1

client_id.description: OAuth 2.0 client identifier string. It SHOULD NOT be currently valid for any other registered client, though an authorization server MAY issue the same client identifier to multiple instances of a registered client at its discretion.

client_id_issued_at.description: Time at which the client identifier was issued. The time is represented as the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z as measured in UTC until the date/time of issuance.

scope.description: If no scope is configured, this value is an empty string ("").

redirect_uris.description: If no redirect URIs are configured, this value is an empty list ([]).

token_endpoint_auth_method.description: If no auth methods are configured, this value is null.

grant_types.description: If no grant types are configured, this value is an empty list ([]).

response_types.description: If no response types are configured, this value is an empty list ([]).

client_name.description: If no value is submitted by the Client, the default value is the client_id.

contacts.description: If no contacts are configured, this value is an empty list ([]).

client_secret.description: Only present when the client was initially created.

cds_created.description: When the Client object was created.

cds_modified.description: When the Client object was last modified.

cds_client_uri.description: Where to submit modifications using the Clients API Modifying Clients functionality. Servers MUST make this URL unique for each Client object.

cds_status.description: The current status of availability for this Client.

cds_status_options.description: What cds_status values the Client MAY change to when modifying it. For Client objects with the client_admin scope, this list MUST NOT contain 'disabled'. For all other Client objects, this list MUST contain at least 'disabled', so that Clients MAY opt to disable Client objects as needed.

cds_server_metadata.description: Where the Client can find their registration-specific version of the CDSC-WG1-01 Server Metadata. If the Client’s registered scopes have different Scope Descriptions than what is in the publicly available oauth_metadata resource, such as more limited coverages_supported or different limits in authorization_details_fields_supported, then the cds_server_metadata MUST be to a resource that has an updated oauth_metadata resource with the Client-specific values. If the Client’s CDSC server metadata is no different from the public CDSC server metadata, Servers MAY simply link to the public URL. If this metadata endpoint requires authentication, Servers MUST authenticate Client requests to this endpoint via Bearer access token obtained using OAuth’s client_credentials grant with a scope of client_admin, and reject unauthenticated requests with a 401 Unauthorized response code. Clients know that they must use a Bearer token when Servers return a 401 response code for this endpoint when the Client makes an unauthenticated request to the endpoint.

cds_default_scope.description: The default scope string used when no scope parameter is provided as part of an authorization request. MUST be included if response_types is not an empty list.

cds_default_redirect_uri.description: The default redirect_uri used when no redirect_uri parameter is provided as part of an authorization request. MUST be included if response_types is not an empty list.

cds_default_authorization_details.description: The default authorization details list used when no authorization_details parameter is provided as part of an authorization request. MUST be included if response_types is not an empty list.

id.description: A unique identifier for the coverage entry

created.description: When this coverage entry was first made available

updated.description: When this coverage entry was last modified

entity_name.description: A human readable name for the entity being covered (e.g. “Demo Gas & Electric”). The entity name in a coverage entry MAY be different than the Server metadata name value in situations where the Server is operated by a parent or other entity.

entity_abbreviation.description: The abbreviation for the entity being covered by the coverage entry (e.g. “DG&E”). This field is to assist Clients in parsing coverage for entities that are commonly known by their abbreviated names (e.g. “DG&E” rather than “Demo Gas & Electric”). If no abbreviation is available for the entity being covered, this value is null.

country.description: An ISO 3166 country code. The country that has jurisdiction over the Coverage Entity. If multiple countries have jurisdiction over a piece of coverage, Servers MUST have multiple Coverage Entries, one for each country having jurisdiction.

name.description: A human readable name for the coverage area or category (e.g. “Upstate New York electric territory”).

description.description: A brief description of the coverage area or category

role.description: The role of the Server in offering capabilities for the coverage entry

infrastructure_types.description: A list of infrastructure categories applicable to the coverage entry

commodity_types.description: A list of services or commodities applicable to the coverage entry

capabilities.description: What capabilities and functionality this Server supports for the coverage entry

map_resource.description: Link to a map of the coverage territory

map_content_type.description: Content-Type format of the map_resource, is a valid mime type according to rfc6838

geojson_resource.description: Link to a GeoJSON object mapping the coverage territory

credentials.description: A list of Credentials to which the requesting access_token is scoped to have access. If no Credentials are accessible, this value is an empty list ([]). If more than 100 sCredentials are available to be listed, Servers MAY truncate the list and use the next value to link to the next segment of the list of Credentials.

credential_id.description: The unique identifier for the Credential on the Server’s system.

uri.description: Where to retrieve, modify, or delete this specific Credential object.

client_id.description: Which Client this Credential belongs to.

modified.description: When the Credential was last modified.

client_secret.description: A sufficiently random value generated by the Server that can be used by the Client to authenticate themselves when obtaining an access_token from the Server’s OAuth token endpoint. This field MUST be included if the type is client_secret.

client_secret_expires_at.description: The timestamp at which the client_secret will expire, as defined in OAuth’s Client Information Response. If the Client object refrenced by the client_id has a status of disabled, this value MUST be set to the time when the Client object was most recently disabled. This field MUST be included if the type is client_secret.

Accounts.description: Clients may request to list Account objects that they have access to by making an HTTPS GET request, authenticated with a valid Bearer access_token that is scoped to provide access to a set of Accounts, to the cds_accounts_api URL included in the Client Registration Response or Clients API. The Account listing request responses are formatted as JSON objects and contain the following named values.

cds_account_id.description: The Server’s unique identifier for this Account object.

cds_created.description: When the Server created this Account object.

cds_modified.description: When the Server last modified this Account object.

cds_account_parent.description: The cds_account_id of a parent Account object of which this Account is grouped under. If the Account is not a part of a parent grouping, this value is null.

customer_number.description: The identifier that a Customer has access to that identifies a collection of Accounts as being for the same Customer. If a Server only stores Accounts as the top-level identifier for Customers, or does not have a Customer-accessible identifier set for this Account, this value is null.

account_number.description: The number that a Customer sees on their bill and online user interface as the identifier for this Account.

account_name.description: The name that a Customer sees on their bill and online user interface as the name for this Account, if available.

account_address.description: The address that a Customer sees on their bill and online user interface as the address for this Account, if available.

account_type.description: What type of Account this is. (Replace with actual Account types)

account_contacts.description: A list of Account Contacts for the Account.

cds_servicecontract_id.description: The Server’s unique identifier for this Service Contract object.

cds_created.description: When the Server created this Service Contract object.

cds_modified.description: When the Server last modified this Service Contract object.

cds_account_id.description: The Account to which this Service Contract belongs.

account_number.description: The Account’s account_number duplicated to this Service Contract.

contract_number.description: The identifier that a Customer sees on their bill or online user interface. Null if not available.

contract_address.description: The address that a Customer sees on their bill or online user interface, if available.

contract_status.description: The current status of the Service Contract.

contract_type.description: The type of agreement that this Service Contract represents.

contract_entity.description: With which entity the Customer has agreement for this Service Contract.

contract_start.description: When the agreement that this Service Contract represents started.

contract_end.description: When the agreement that this Service Contract represents ended. Null if ongoing.

service_type.description: The type of utility or other service that this Service Contract provides.

service_class.description: The class of service for which this Service Contract is categorized.

rateplan_code.description: A unique code for the current rate plan or tariff on which costs for this Service Contract are calculated.

rateplan_name.description: The name that a Customer sees on their bill or online user interface as the rate plan or tariff that applies to this Service Contract.

cds_servicepoint_id.description: The Server’s unique identifier for this Service Point object.

cds_created.description: When the Server created this Service Point object.

cds_modified.description: When the Server last modified this Service Point object.

servicepoint_number.description: The identifier that a Customer sees on their bill or online user interface. Null if not available.

servicepoint_type.description: The type of service point that this Service Point represents.

servicepoint_address.description: The address that a Customer sees on their bill or online user interface, if available. Null if not available.

latitude.description: The latitude of the Service Point. Null if not available.

longitude.description: The longitude of the Service Point. Null if not available.

current_servicecontracts.description: The list of Service Contract unique identifiers currently providing service to this Service Point.

previous_servicecontracts.description: The list of Service Contract unique identifiers that have previously provided service to this Service Point.

premise_number.description: The premise identifier a Customer sees on their bill or online interface. Null if not available.

premise_type.description: The premise type a Customer sees on their bill or online interface. Null if not available.

cds_meterdevice_id.description: The Server’s unique identifier for this Meter Device object.

cds_created.description: When the Server created this Meter Device object.

cds_modified.description: When the Server last modified this Meter Device object.

meter_number.description: The identifier that a Customer sees on their bill, online user interface, or on the face of their physical meter. Null if not available.

meter_type.description: The type of metering device that this Meter Device represents.

current_servicepoints.description: The list of Service Point unique identifiers where this Meter Device is currently installed or associated.

previous_servicepoints.description: The list of Service Point unique identifiers where this Meter Device was previously installed or associated.

cds_billsection_id.description: The Server’s unique identifier for this Bill Section object.

cds_created.description: When the Server created this Bill Section object.

cds_modified.description: When the Server last modified this Bill Section object.

cds_billstatement_id.description: The Bill Statement for which this Bill Section was issued. If the Client is not authorized to see the related Bill Statement, this value is null.

cds_account_id.description: The Account for which this Bill Section was issued.

account_number.description: The Account’s account_number at the time that this Bill Section was issued.

section_type.description: The type of bill section that this Bill Section represents.

start_date.description: The start date of services provided for which this Bill Section covers.

end_date.description: The end date of services provided for which this Bill Section covers.

currency.description: The ISO 4217 currency code for this Bill Section’s charge values.

distribution_entity.description: The details for the utility or other entity providing distribution for the services that this Bill Section covers. If the services provided that are covered by this Bill Section do not have distribution, this value is null.

load_serving_entity.description: The details for the utility or other entity providing distribution for the services that this Bill Section covers. If the services provided that are covered by this Bill Section do not have a supply or retailer component, this value is null. If the load serving entity is the same as the distributor, the Load Serving Entity type value MUST be distributor and no other fields are populated in the Load Serving Entity object.

related_servicecontracts.description: The list of Service Contract unique identifiers to which this Bill Section is applicable. This list MUST only include identifiers that the Client is authorized to see as scoped by their requesting access_token.

related_servicepoints.description: The list of Service Point unique identifiers to which this Bill Section is applicable. This list MUST only include identifiers that the Client is authorized to see as scoped by their requesting access_token.

related_meterdevices.description: The list of Meter Device unique identifiers to which this Bill Section is applicable. This list MUST only include identifiers that the Client is authorized to see as scoped by their requesting access_token.

related_billsections.description: The list of other Bill Section unique identifiers that were issued alongside this Bill Section, where those Bill Sections represent another set of charges covering the same Service Contract. This list MUST only include identifiers that the Client is authorized to see as scoped by their requesting access_token.

line_items.description: A list of the Bill Section Line Item objects that denote the individual charges listed on the Customer-facing bill statement section represented by this Bill Section.

energy_summary.description: A list of the Bill Section Energy Summary objects that detail the service’s energy usage and other values on the Customer-facing bill statement section represented by this Bill Section.

cds_usagesegment_id.description: The Server’s unique identifier for this Usage Segment object.

cds_created.description: When the Server created this Usage Segment object.

cds_modified.description: When the Server last modified this Usage Segment object.

items.description: The unique identifiers for Aggregations to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

related_aggregations.description: The list of Aggregation unique identifiers to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

items.description: The unique identifiers for Accounts to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

related_accounts.description: The list of Account unique identifiers to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

items.description: The unique identifiers for Service Contracts to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

related_servicecontracts.description: The list of Service Contract unique identifiers to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

items.description: The unique identifiers for Service Points to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

related_servicepoints.description: The list of Service Point unique identifiers to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

items.description: The unique identifiers for Meter Devices to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

related_meterdevices.description: The list of Meter Device unique identifiers to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

items.description: The unique identifiers for Bill Sections to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

related_billsections.description: The list of Bill Section unique identifiers to which this Usage Segment is applicable.

segment_start.description: The starting timestamp for the list of Usage Segment values.

segment_end.description: The ending timestamp for the list of Usage Segment values.

interval.description: How long between values, in seconds.

items.description: The formats of the values, presented in the order in which the values are presented.

oneOf.description: General Electric Usage in kWh object
Forward Electric Usage in kWh object
Reverse Electric Usage in kWh object
Net Electric Usage in kWh object
Aggregated Electric Usage in kWh object
Water Usage in Cubic Meters object
Water Usage in Cubic Feet object
Natural Gas Usage in Therms object
Natural Gas Usage in CCF object
Natural Gas Usage in MCF object
Natural Gas Usage in mmBTU object

format.description: For each entry in values, these are the formats that are included.

items.description: A list of Value Sets representing the entries included in the Usage Segment.

values.description: A list of Value Sets that represent the entries included in the Usage Segment.

next.description: URL to the next page of results

previous.description: URL to the previous page of results
